intro: Phaulopsis imbricata subsp. poggei, commonly known as the Pogge's phaulopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to warm, humid climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
